data.name: Reebok Ragnar Road Wasatch Back
data.intro:
We have an important announcement for this year's Wasatch Back. This is the LAST YEAR on the original course! Yes, after 2020 we will be announcing a brand new course for Wasatch Back. To celebrate our final year on this course, we will be awarding a number of Official Course Records that will remain in the history books for all future generations. And trust us, there are a lot of records to set before the course changes up for 2021 — from fastest team to most popsicles eaten during the Ragnar Leg.

For one last time, runners come together on June 12 in Logan to kick off their adventure, conquering one of the more difficult races in the Ragnar series. From there, teams run two days and one star-filled night, through friendly communities, up stunning green mountainsides. You'll make your way through the wildflowers in Avon Pass and into a postcard-worthy countryside dotted with horses and quintessential barns.

After each team member completes their 3 legs, you’ll cross under the orange arch as a team once again at one of the best finish lines ever at High Star Ranch in Kamas. Tired but triumphant, you'll do together what you could never do alone.
data.waiver:
Race Release and Waiver

As a condition of my participation in the 2015 Ragnar Relay Wasatch Back (the “Event”) as a runner, volunteer or otherwise, I hereby covenant not to sue, and agree to release from liability, the Ragnar Relay Series, together with its founders, owners, officers, directors, managers, agents and employees, including but not limited to (a) Ragnar Events LLC, Ragnar Holdings LLC, Dolphin BRE LLC, Dolphin Capital Group LLC, and their respective officers, directors, managers, members, agents and employees; (b) Ragnar Relay race officials and volunteers; and (c) any and all other sponsors, suppliers, agents, independent contractors and other personnel in any way assisting or associated with this Event (collectively “Releasees”).  This Race Release and Waiver (this “Release”)is a contract with legal and binding consequences and it applies to all activities relating to the Event, whether located on the race course, exchanges or other race-related venues.  I have read this Release carefully before signing, and I understand what it means and what I am agreeing to by signing. 

In consideration of the acceptance of my application for entry or participation as a volunteer in this Event by one or more Releasees, I hereby freely agree to and make the following additional contractual representations and agreements: 

I know that this Event, which takes place both in daylight and at night, is held on open roads and is a potentially hazardous activity.  I voluntarily assume full and complete responsibility for all risks associated with participating in the Event and for any injury or accident that may occur during my participation in this Event, including by way of example and not limitation: (a) illness; (b) traveling to and from the event; (c) falls; (d) collisions with pedestrians, vehicles, other participants, and fixed or moving objects; (e) the effects of weather, including temperature extremes and humidity; (f) traffic accidents; (g) the negligence of myself and/or others, including Releasees; (h) animal attacks; and (i) road conditions, including darkness and surface conditions such as pot holes. 

I am aware of and appreciate all of these risks.  I understand that both vehicle traffic and spectators will be present along the race course and that police protection will not be provided.  I know that the presence of vehicle traffic during the race increases the risk of motor vehicle accidents involving participants, spectators, and/or other vehicles, and that such accidents can result in death or serious injury. 

As a condition of my participation, I agree to abide by all traffic and pedestrian laws and regulations and to follow any and all of Releasees’ safety instructions, including all rules and conditions set forth in the Race Bible, which is available on the Ragnar Relay Series website, www.ragnarrelay.com.  I understand that my failure to do so may result in serious injury or death and may be grounds for my disqualification from this Event. 

I acknowledge that I should not enter and participate in this Event unless I am medically able and properly trained.  I agree to abide by any decision of a race official relative to my ability to safely complete this road race and I further agree that race officials may authorize necessary emergency treatment for me.  

Having read this Release and knowing and assuming these risks, and in consideration of the acceptance of my participation, I hereby for myself, my heirs, my executors, administrators or anyone else who might claim on my behalf (collectively my “Successors”), again covenant not to sue, and FOREVER WAIVE, RELEASE, DISCHARGE, and HOLD HARMLESS Releasees from any and all claims or liability of any kind or nature whatsoever arising out of my participation in this Event, even though such liability may arise out of negligence or carelessness on the part of Releasees. 

In exchange for my being permitted to participate in the Event, and understanding there will be no additional compensation to me, I hereby authorize Ragnar Events LLC, to use my image or likeness for race promotional purposes.  I understand the race registration fees are nonrefundable.  I have read the Race Bible and agree to abide by the rules and conditions contained therein.

I acknowledge and agree, for myself and my Successors, that the above representations are contractually binding, and are not mere recitals, and that should I or my Successors assert a claim contrary to what I have agreed to in this Release, the claiming party shall be liable for the expenses (including legal fees) incurred by the Releasees in defending such claim. This Release may not be modified orally, and a waiver or modification of any provision shall not be construed as a waiver or modification of any other provision herein or as consent to any subsequent waiver or modification. I consent to the release by any third party to Releasees and their insurance carriers of my name and medical information that may relate to any injury or death I may suffer arising from my participation in the Event. Every term and provision of this Release is intended to be severable. If any one or more of them is found to be unenforceable or invalid, that shall not affect the other terms and provisions, which shall remain binding and enforceable.
data.charity:
The Park City Education Foundation is a non-profit fundraising organization dedicated to elevating quality and advancing innovations in education. By using contributions, PCEF is able to support educational programs and opportunities for students and teachers at all schools in the Park City School District.

 

 

Neuroworx

Neuroworx is a nonprofit, community-based, outpatient physical therapy clinic focusing on neurological rehabilitation for individuals experiencing paralysis from spinal cord injuries, brain injuries, stroke, and other neurological conditions. We also offer a pediatric therapy program for children with neurological conditions requiring specialized care and equipment.Our mission is to promote neurological rehabilitation and to create and support the finest comprehensive neurological rehabilitation facility in the region.

After Ainsley opened the Ragnar door for assisted-athletes to partake in the Ragnar Race Series in 2013, Ainsley's Angels decided to continue to partake with Angel Athlete riders from across the Nation! For the last 5 years, our Angel Athlete riders have been included and accepted in over a dozen Ragnar events, and over the next 2 years we will continue to do so with at least 25 Ragnar teams executing our Together, We Shall spirit across the Ragnar Nation! YOU can be included too! IF you would like to join one of our teams of Ainsley's Ragnarians, now is the time to take the leap! Click HERE to learn more. 

If you are interested in running on behalf of AInsley's Angels, please contact ragnar@ainsleysangels.org.

updates.title: Course Update
updates.content: Hi Ragnar Runners! There have been a few course updates added to the website as of today. Exchange 17 has moved from Riverside Park to Ridley's Family Market in Morgan UT. Legs 17 and 18 have been adjusted for this. Due to construction happening and Echo State Park, Exchange 23 has moved further down Echo Reservior to South Beach. This makes Leg 23 longer then last year and Leg 24 shorter. Exchange 28 has moved to Trailside Park in Synderville UT. This in turn has changed the distance for legs 28 and 29 as well. Please take the time to review these changes and plan accordingly. Good luck with all the training and look forward to seeing you all in June!

For and in consideration of USA Track & Field, Inc. (“USA Track & Field”) allowing me, the undersigned, to participate in the USA Track & Field sanctioned Ragnar Relay Series event (the “Event” or “Events”); I, for myself, and on behalf of my spouse, children, guardians, heirs and next of kin, and any legal and personal representatives, executors, administrators, successors and assigns, hereby agree to and make the following contractual representations pursuant to this Waiver and Release of Liability, Assumption of Risk and Indemnity Agreement (the “Agreement”):

 

1.     I hereby represent that (i) I am at least eighteen (18) years of age (or this Agreement is agreed to by my parent, natural guardian, or legal guardian (the “Guardian”)); (ii) I am in good health and in proper physical condition to participate in the Event; and (iii) I am not under the influence of alcohol or any illicit or prescription drugs which would in any way impair my ability to safely participate in the Event. I agree that it is my sole responsibility to determine whether I am sufficiently fit and healthy enough to participate in the Event, that I am responsible for my own safety and well-being at all times and under all circumstances while at the Event site.

2.     I understand and acknowledge that participation in track & field, road running, race walking, cross country, mountain, ultra, and trail running Events is inherently dangerous and represents an extreme test of a person’s physical and mental limits. I understand and acknowledge the risks and dangers associated with participation in the Event and sport of track & field and related activities, including without limitation, the potential for serious bodily injury, sickness and disease, permanent disability, paralysis and loss of life; loss of or damage to equipment/property; exposure to extreme conditions and circumstances; contact with other participants, spectators, animals or other natural or manmade objects; dangers arising from adverse weather conditions; imperfect course or track conditions; land, water and surface hazards; equipment failure; inadequate safety measures; participants of varying skill levels; situations beyond the immediate control of the Event Organizers; and other undefined, not readily foreseeable and presently unknown risks and dangers (“Risks”). I understand that these Risks may be caused in whole or in part by my own actions or inactions, the actions or inactions of others participating in the Event, or the negligent acts or omissions of the Released Parties defined below, and I hereby expressly assume all such Risks and responsibility for any damages, liabilities, losses or expenses which I incur as a result of my participation in any Event.

3.     I agree to be familiar with and to abide by the Rules and Regulations established for the Event, including but not limited to the Competition Rules adopted by USA Track & Field and any safety regulations established for the benefit of all participants. I accept sole responsibility for my own conduct and actions while participating in the Event, and the condition and adequacy of my equipment.

4.     I hereby release, waive and covenant not to sue, and further agree to indemnify, defend and hold harmless the following parties: USA Track & Field, Inc., its members, clubs, associations, sport disciplines and divisions; United States Olympic Committee (USOC); the event directors, the host organization and the facility, venue and property owners or operators upon which the Event takes place; and any other organizers, promoters, sponsors, advertisers, coaches and officials for this Event; law enforcement agencies and other public entities providing support for the Event; and each of their respective parent, subsidiary and affiliated companies, officers, directors, partners, shareholders, members, agents, employees and volunteers (Individually and collectively, the “Released Parties” or “Event Organizers”), with respect to any liability, claim(s), demand(s), cause(s) of action, damage(s), loss or expense (including court costs and attorneys’ fees) of any kind or nature (“Liability”) which may arise out of, result from, or relate in any way to my participation in the Event, including claims for Liability caused in whole or in part by the negligent acts or omissions of the Released Parties. 5.     Having read this Release and knowing and assuming these risks, and in consideration of the acceptance of my participation, I hereby for myself, my heirs, my executors, administrators or anyone else who might claim on their own behalf or my behalf (collectively my “Successors”), covenant not to sue, and FOREVER WAIVE, RELEASE, DISCHARGE, and HOLD HARMLESS Releasees from any and all claims, injuries, damages, liabilities, causes of action, and expenses (including without limitation consequential damages, incidental damages, and attorney’s fees and costs), and inconvenience to person or property (collectively, “Losses”)  of any kind or nature whatsoever arising out of or related to my registration or participation in this Event, even though such losses may arise out of negligence or carelessness on the part of Releasees.  If and to the extent any court of competent jurisdiction finds this release and waiver to be unenforceable, I nevertheless agree that the Releasees’ liability to me and my Successors for Losses (under any legal theory or claim, including without limitation tort liability) shall not exceed the total dollar amount of registration fees paid by me.

8.     I acknowledge and agree that it is prohibited for any unmanned aerial system (more commonly known as a “drone”) to be flown above the Event course at any time during the Event, or while Event participants, either immediately before or after the Event, are in the vicinity of the Event course.

Location:

Utah State University Track (Ralph Maughan)

Parking Lot

850 E 1200 N

Logan, UT 84322

Time:

Thursday, June 13, 2019

 5:00 PM - 9:00 PM

Sweet Happenings:

Check In (Both Vans)

Safety Briefings (Both Vans)

Packet Pick-up (Both Vans)

Team T-Shirt Pick-Up (Both Vans)

Hydration Stations

Late Runner Add/Substitutions

Partners:

KT Tape: An elastic tape designed to relieve muscle, ligament and joint pain for over 24 hours, without sacrificing style. Visit the KT Tape tent and learn from a rep on how to properly tape your muscles before performance.
Want to stop blisters? Swing by the KT Tape booth to receive a complimentary sample of their new Blister Prevention tape! You can also consult with the KT Tape team to learn how to tape like a pro, with their PRO Extreme KT Tape!
 
Thursday Night KT TAPE Benefits
 KT Tape is designed to bond to skin for up to a week, to do so effectively, the skin needs to be fully prepped before applying, and this process should be done well before anticipating sweat or moisture. The further in advance the tape is applied, the longer it tends to last on the skin, providing the benefits all the while! Tape can be applied up to 24 hours before a race; doing so may create a better hold to withstand an entire weekend of racing. On behalf of KT Tape, we encourage Ragnar runners to take advantage of Thursday night check-in to visit with the KT Tape staff and receive any tape you may need for the race!

Progenex:  is committed to providing quality products that will prepare you for training and accelerate recovery. Return to your next workout or adventure faster and stronger in the pursuit of the lifestyle you were born to live. Stop by the Progenex tent to sample their protein powder.

 

In order to check-in, you must bring the following: 

  • All 6 members of your van
  • Ragnar Required safety gear: 6 Reflective Vests, 2 Headlamps & 2 Tail Lights (Ragnar Safety Bundle)

facts.0: When I was about 5 or 6 years old I got lost in a mall. By the time my dad found me I scored a free hat from a manager that felt bad seeing me sob like a toddler in front of his store. Moral of the story is... getting lost in a mall may get you free stuff.
facts.1: I can honestly say I've rented more port a potties in my lifetime then I've seen movies. Not something I'm proud of:(
facts.2:
There are two ideal ways I want to leave this world

1) Running myself to death
or 
2) Being dropped off in the mountains with a bucket of KFC and a bottle of Mountain Dew

either way, I'll feel full and have an elevated heart rate before the end.

director.description:
There are 2 quotes that motivate me to keep running. 

1.  "Everyone runs in her own way, or his own way. And where does the power come from, to see the race to its end?... From within."  (Eric Liddell) 

2.  “Every morning in Africa, a gazelle wakes up, it knows it must outrun the fastest lion or it will be killed. Every morning in Africa, a lion wakes up. It knows it must run faster than the slowest gazelle, or it will starve. It doesn’t matter whether you’re the lion or a gazelle – when the sun comes up, you’d better be running.”  (Christopher McDougall)

Running has been apart of my life since I was a young kid. It gives me the freedom to explore and time to meditate. I love the internal struggle of mind over body and enjoy pushing myself to new limits. Im honored to be a Race Director at Ragnar and love putting on events that encourage the laziest, in us all, to get off the couch and do more.  Please reach out to me if you have any questions about Wasatch Back (Road) and or Florida (Trail). 

wstrauss@runragnar.com

Happy Running!

details.name: Ragnar Courtesy Campaign | Love the Locals

legs.notes:
Starting line located in the parking lot of USU football stadium. 

Ragnar will provide 1 water station on this leg. In effort to be more sustainable these water stations will not have cups. Please carry a water bottle.

Water Station 1 is being managed by amazing volunteers from SkyView Marching Band: (They are also helping with exchange 6 set up,Startline, Exchange 16 and 24)

The Sky View Marching Band is a high school band program located in Smithfield, UT. Every year this group of students compete in a series of marching band competitions across the state. The money raised will go towards competition costs, as well as equipment upkeep, food, and travel during the 2019 competition season.

Exchange 4 is being managed by amazing volunteers from Neuroworx:

Neuroworx is a non-profit outpatient rehabilitation clinic providing innovative, after-hospital physical, occupational, and speech therapy for adults and children dealing with paralysis from spinal cord injuries, brain injuries, stroke, cerebral palsy, and similar neurological conditions. The treatment focus promotes neurological recovery to maximizing functional ability with the goal of increasing personal independence, improving overall health and enhancing quality of life.  Our mission is to provide this to these individuals while eliminating as many of the financial barriers to progress as possible.   Donations received through Ragnar allow us to do this.

Exchange 20 is being managed by amazing volunteers from Layton's 28th Ward

Our volunteers from the Layton 28th Ward this year are made up of 9 young men ages 12-13, their parents and our young men’s leaders.  The opportunity to involve our youth in being volunteers for Ragnar helps our youth learn responsibility, accountability, service, and good work ethics that will help them grow into adulthood.  The funds we raise through volunteering will be used for Boy Scout camp registrations, weekly youth activities, and camp supplies that will be used in overnight camp outs.  Our youth have shown more excitement to volunteer for this even than any other activity we have participated in.  We hope that our services will be as beneficial to those we come in contact with as this opportunity is to each one of us.

Exchange 25 is being managed by amazing volunteers from The University of Utah Club Swim and Dive Team

The University of Utah Club Swim and Dive Team is a co-ed, intercollegiate, competitive, and student-run swim team at the University of Utah. In the past, our team competed against local US Masters teams but has since gone on to establish a foothold in the College Club Swimming Division. For instance, our team placed 25th overall at the 2018 CCS National Championships and has achieved an 11th place overall finish at the 2019 CCS National Championships. The college club experience allows our team members to pursue their athletic ambitions while excelling at their academic and professional pursuits and, like most student groups, we strive to serve our community through the participation in a myriad of philanthropic projects and organizations. Our program has seen incredible growth and is run by student volunteers who have the ambition and expertise to operate and expand a highly competitive and capable team!

exchanges.name: Pre-Race Packet Pick Up
exchanges.description:
Location:

Utah State University Track (Ralph Maughan)

Parking Lot

850 E 1200 N

Logan, UT 84322

Time:

Thursday, June 11, 2020

 5:00 PM - 9:00 PM

Sweet Happenings:

Check In (Both Vans)

Safety Briefings (Both Vans)

Packet Pick-up (Both Vans)

Team T-Shirt Pick-Up (Both Vans)

Hydration Stations

Late Runner Add/Substitutions

Partners:

KT Tape: An elastic tape designed to relieve muscle, ligament and joint pain for over 24 hours, without sacrificing style. Visit the KT Tape tent and learn from a rep on how to properly tape your muscles before performance. The further in advance the tape is applied, the longer it tends to last on the skin, providing the benefits all the while! Tape can be applied up to 24 hours before a race; doing so may create a better hold to withstand an entire weekend of racing. On behalf of KT Tape, we encourage Ragnar runners to take advantage of Thursday night check-in to visit with the KT Tape staff and receive any tape you may need for the race!

Want to stop blisters? Swing by the KT Tape booth to receive a complimentary sample of their new Blister Prevention tape! You can also consult with the KT Tape team to learn how to tape like a pro, with their PRO Extreme KT Tape!

Progenex: is committed to providing quality products that will prepare you for training and accelerate recovery. Return to your next workout or adventure faster and stronger in the pursuit of the lifestyle you were born to live. Stop by the Progenex tent to sample their protein powder.

Intermountain Healthcare: 

FitN40: Growing older doesn’t mean you have to give in to the ailments of aging! FITN40+ is the FIRST BRAND of Sports Nutrition designed to target the physical needs of Men & Women over 40! Each FITN40+ product is a Premium Formula that can help you combat the barriers of aging while staying fit and active. When used together, they create the Ultimate 40+ Workout System to help keep your body working at peak performance, no matter what your age!

AMP Human Performance: PR lotion is The World's First Product That Neutralizes Acid in Your Muscles with Bicarb. THE Sports Lotion you Apply Before Your Run to Help you Train Harder & Recover Faster. Reduces Lactic Acid. For Major Muscle Groups.

Packet Pick-up (Van #2)

Late Runner Add/Substitutions

Partners:

Reebok: Drop by the Reebok tent to pick up your FREE Captain's survival kit, take a team photo and check out the latest in running shoe technology.  

**Captain's survival kits are only available during the race and must be claimed in person at the Reebok Running Experience tent at Exchange 6**

Nathan: From hydration to essential safety gear like headlamps and reflective vests, Nathan Sports makes performance-driven products to help you conquer any Ragnar leg. Come check out all the sweet gear!

Progenex: Progenex is committed to providing quality products that will prepare you for training and accelerate recovery. Return to your next workout or adventure faster and stronger in the pursuit of the lifestyle you were born to live. Stop by the Progenex tent to sample their protein powder.

Spry: Innovative dental professionals around the world are talking to their patients about the Spry Dental Defense System because of its proven oral health benefits. Immediate results, research has shown that effectively using Spry for as little as a few months, may have longer-lasting results that remain for years. Test it out for yourself and see the results.

FBOMB: FBOMBs are durable and portable pouches full of all-natural nut butters or 100% pure premium oils. They're custom designed so you can drop an FBOMB anytime, anywhere. Taste test an FBOMB by visiting their tent.

KT TAPE: An elastic tape designed to relieve muscle, ligament and joint pain for over 24 hours, without sacrificing style. Visit the KT Tape tent and learn from a rep on how to properly tape your muscles before performance.
Want to stop blisters? Swing by the KT Tape booth to receive a complimentary sample of their new Blister Prevention tape! You can also consult with the KT Tape team to learn how to tape like a pro, with their PRO Extreme KT Tape!

Nikwax: Looking to extend the life of your baselayers and footwear? Swing by the Nikwax tent at Exchange 6 to learn how to properly wash, deodorize, and freshen your technical baselayers and running footwear, keeping them functioning at their peak. After all, if you care for your gear it will care for you!

TriggerPoint: Are your muscles sore or tight? Roll out with foam rollers and handheld massage sticks from TriggerPoint for post-run relief. Designed with GRID technology to replicate the feeling of a massage therapist, TriggerPoint products are leading the way in self-massage recovery.

Test it out for yourself at the Recovery Zone.
 
Balega: These running socks are expertly designed and crafted from heel to toe for superior performance that keeps pace for all runners.

Allegro Coffee: We believe in coffee with character. The medium roast features warm, velvety notes and is a balanced, full-bodied cup that’s perfect for any time of day. Come stop by the coffee bus to test it out for your self.

FitN40: Growing older doesn’t mean you have to give in to the ailments of aging! FITN40+ is the FIRST BRAND of Sports Nutrition designed to target the physical needs of Men & Women over 40! Each FITN40+ product is a Premium Formula that can help you combat the barriers of aging while staying fit and active. When used together, they create the Ultimate 40+ Workout System to help keep your body working at peak performance, no matter what your age!

Fat Boy Ice Cream: Stop by the Fat Boy booth for some delicious (and well earned) ice cream!

Homie: Homie combines technology, innovative software, and expert customer service to make buying or selling a home fast and easy.  Stop by their tent for a snow cone and to learn more about how they can help you through the real estate buying/selling process!

details.title: Love The Locals: Road
details.text:
Ragnar is a beautiful thing. We want to keep it going for as long as we can, and we want our runners and communities to be happy. Our relays cannot happen without permission from the locals and it is so important that we cultivate good relationships with the people of the places we run through. 
BE  QUIET IN QUIET ZONES ** KEEP VAN TAGS CLEAN AND RESPECTABLE ** BE NICE TO VOLUNTEERS **  RESPECT OTHER PEOPLE'S PROPERTY ** COMPLY WITH TRAFFIC AND PEDESTRIAN LAWS ** PARK IN AUTHORISED SPACES ** RUN ON PAVEMENTS WHERE YOU CAN **
